intro: Godetia lepida var. arnottii, commonly known as the Arnott's godetia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant color and delicate appearance.
